Description: Gown; woven of silk; rectangle of bright yellow silk, ends folded over and sewn along top edge to make open-fronted gown; holes cut near side tops for armholes; decorated with silver embroidery along front edges, around armholes, and down centre back.
Curator's comments: The donation book describes the gift as "A sik gown and silver and carved coral necklace collected in Egypt during the residence of the donor's sister and brother-in-law Lt Col. Patrick Andrew Clayton, DSO, in the period around 1920-5'.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995, London, Museum of Mankind (Room 5), 'Display and Modesty'
Acquisition name: Donated by: Miss Agnes L Wyatt
Acquisition notes: Af1978,13.1 and 2 were given by Miss Agnes L Wyatt
